comment: She pretty good but only if you really like anthropology
No Tests. No Quizzes. 2 Presentations. Midterm was an abstract.... This class sounds easy sure, but no. It is just not.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: 2 group projects/presentation, 1 individual presentation. Meet the requirements she gives and youll do just fine on them. Does in class journals used with the textbook. Get a used textbook, online code isnt necessary.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS--Gives good feedback

comment: The best ksu 1101 professor! Super understanding and chill! 2 Group projects and 1 individual project! Just do your part and shell take care of you
Easy A. One final "quiz" and many weekly group assignments in class. Makes you present them. Easy grading system. Final quiz is a little difficult. She didn't cover what was on the "quiz" in class..
Very easy A. Very nice and passionate professor. Doesn't want you to memorize so if you're not trying to learn you don't have to.

I adored Professor Cockrell. She's funny and very knowledgable. Some students may feel put on the spot by her Socratic method of teaching, but she just loves to get the class excited about discussions. There are a whole lot of online assignments though, so just make sure to do them and you'll be fine.

Seriously the worst professor I have ever had. It was a very easy A. The quizzes were over things she never talked about and sometimes the material wasn't even in the book. We watched a lot of movies which wasted my time and gas to drive to school. Take her for an easy A but prepare to be bored.

Okay, so she might be a little confusing, but she loves class discussions and critical thinking. So either know what you're talking about when you answer a question or don't say anything. Seriously I barely talked in the class and got a 93. No quizzes, just online discussions and a few papers that aren't very hard. Open note final. Not a bad class!

Probably the worst prof ever. She assigns papers and never explains. Shuts down every answer a student gives. Lectures are so boring, by mid semester everyone stops going. Asks for things that are supposedly in the book and gets mad when people can't find it. Incredibly rude if you ask for help. Read on your own, and do the discussions.
easiest. class. ever. 2 papers, easily graded. no tests. and 4 online, open book quizzes. the class itsself isnt what I expected or too interesting but it is an easy overall class.

Nice teacher, you can get an A if you go to class and do the work. A couple of easy papers and online quizzes but go to class if you expect a good grade. She does not respond to e-mails and can be a bit rude during classroom discussion. Tends to "shoot people down." Assignments are vague but I think she is just trying to make you think.

Class was on-line.  Very much a self-service course.  Instructor's guidelines are vague as well as organization of activities and assignments.  She did not engage in on-line discussions.  What you learn comes out of the textbook and videos.

She is an alright professor, but she is extremely boring and not very good at teaching the material. I recommend going to class everyday even though it is not required. She give in class assignments/projects that she does not put online. There are a few easy papers and online discussions and quizzes. Easy class if you go every day.
ok teacher. Reads off powerpoint but quizzes are very easy with all open noted since they are on the computer. Just go to class and take notes and youll be fine. VERY nice lady.

Wonderful teacher. She is, however; very interested in spurring discussion in class more than anything. As long as you go to class, be very active in discussions, and do all the online discussions and quizzes, you will do absolutely fine :) Take the class with a friend to share the book and make it fun!

Class was easy enough. More like a hybrid considering quizzes and assignments are submitted online. Likes to hear from students in class discussions and you get more points for participating. Quizzes are open book/notes. Online discussions are also mandatory but I doubt she checks to see whether or not our posts are 'original'.

Engages you to come up with your own answers. Makes you think. Easy to talk to... Just do the work! She does not accept late or missed work. Easy class if you keep up with the work and talk in class discussions...otherwiseyou will not do well

The bulk of the class were freshmen who were freaking out over little things. Guys, she's not that bad. 3 tests, all open notes (not with laptop), 1 paper, and a presentation. If you prefer to sit and let her talk, don't take her. she wants to hear your input which is what COLLEGE IS ABOUT. Easy A, nonetheless.

Although this is an easy A class, she enters grades wrong in the computer and does not respond to your emails resulting in a HUGE grading ordeal.  DO NOT BUY THE BOOK.  You do not use it.  Tests are open notes, but she is the WORST communicator I have ever had.  Very confusing teaching style & the lectures are always student led.

Took her online. She is completely disorganized. Doesn't pay attention to emails. Quizzes are a joke. BUT THIS IS AN EASY A. Just do the assignments. I don't think she even reads the discussions posted because I missed a bunch and still got an A.

She's a nice person, but her class sucks. She always tried to make herself look good and would never answer questions with a direct answer. The majority of the class is student-led presentations & half the time, their info was wrong. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROFESSOR. She doesnt help & she doesnt grade on time.

Professor Cockrell really likes for you to participate in the class discussions. Her tests are open notes. There is no point in buying her book because all of her test questions are based off of the lectures and powerpoints. The field research is a joke. She is a fair grader. But this class is kinda pointless. It's an easy A if you do ALL the work.

Avoid her at all costs. She is the most disorganized teacher i have ever had. Her "teaching" style was horrid. Most of the class consisted of student led presentation that were completely pointless.She used the student presentations as an opportunity to pick-it students apart and show how "smart" she is. I found her whole demeanor very rude

agreed. she is a TERRIBLE pro. she didn't even know our class was 2 credit hours. never graded anything within a reasonable timeframe, if she graded it at all. she's patronizing, sarcastic, & makes people feel idiotic. DONT TAKE HER!

oh my god... whoever wrote these other ratings is dilirious..... this teacher is horrible. she NEVER gives straight answers, she never helps you without giving some sarcastic comment as to why you need help, her teaching style is ineffective and she is just a sarcastic moody person. don't take her class unless you want to stress out 24/7

Don't be fooled by the easiness of this teacher's lectures..Tests are really difficult (I recommend memorizing the book). Assignments are eaasy but this teacher slacks on prompt grading at the end of the semester.

This was an online course.  If you like to be on the computer 24/7, this one's for you.  If you like lack of communication and interaction from a professor, this one's for you as well.  However, it's an easy A if you go by the syllabus exactly.  Be prepared to teach yourself.
Kind of "loopy" and laid back. Class materials were very "high school" with projects and such.

Great class. I never used the book just took notes from powerpoint, if you can't take notes go ahead and buy the book, it's basically the same as the powerpoints. Lenient but expects you to go to class and participate, can be a bit dry lecturing. If you take notes, speak up in class and skim the vocab and general knowledge before exams, easy A

Really easy class. Tests are short and easy as long as you take notes and read book. Papers are easy too. Show up to class because she doesnt take attendence but she knows! I never spoke but still got 100% participation cause I came to class. She loves class discussions but gets irritated if no one talks. She is funny and down to earth.

I love her class,I also love Anthropology. She is very fair.  Study guides, are you kidding me this is college you don't get study guides. Tests are not hard if you study and she gives extra credit and open book tests sometimes. Sounds to me like folks want a free ride with minimal effort, that's not what college is about.
She is fantastic, brilliant, and loves what she teaches. If you don't like to think, don't take her class.
Is very passive

Ok... I don't understand these other ratings at all. She is an open minded teacher, very GRACEFUL, interesting, fun, kind, and my ONLY complaint is that she's a little disorganized. Read the book, take notes, ask questions. She has never been rude, patronizing, if you respect classmates and don't make offensive comments during discussion. THINK.

Ok... I don't understand these other ratings at all. She is an amazing teacher, probably the best I've ever had, including my teachers from high school. Read the book, take notes, ask questions. She has never been rude, patronizing, any of that stuff. She is SO kind, interesting, fun, and I truly enjoy learning from her. It's easy if you study :]

This professor covered for another professor at the beginning of the year. If you read all of the chapters you will do well on the tests. She is very blunt and her lectures are from the book. The best thing about her is that she is very passionate about anthropology and  did a lot of field studies. I wish she could portray her love in a better way.

The worst Professor ever. Her tests never matched what we learned in class. The textbook wasn't much help either. She stopped taking attendance halfway through the semester. She wasn't very helpful and had now idea what she was doing or talking about. A lot of class participation and "group conversations". It was also extremely boring. Avoid her!!

Painfully reminiscent to high school; if you enjoy reciting vocabulary words off the power point (which was copy and pasted directly from the text book) and being tactfully patronized; take the class. However, she did allow corrections on every test and extra credit and was lenient w/ deadlines.

fun and interesting but..UG! This class was ridiculous. I know she was trying her best and working so hard, but she was so difficult to follow. notes and tests were bizarre and random--never kept the same style or sequence. no study guides. no reviews. however she did allow corrections, which helped a lot. requires feedback, so TRY to follow along.
